org.activebpel.rt.bpel.server.engine.storage
Class AePersistentQueueManager

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.AeManagerAdapter
      org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.AeBaseQueueManager
          org.activebpel.rt.bpel.server.engine.AeInMemoryQueueManager
              org.activebpel.rt.bpel.server.engine.storage.AePersistentQueueManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAeManager, IAeQueueManager
public class AePersistentQueueManager
extends AeInMemoryQueueManager

Implements a persistent queue manager. This is a version of the bpel engine queue manager that will remember its state even across engine restarts. The class delegates the work of actually saving state to a persistent queue store.

findMatchForInboundReceive

protected AeMessageReceiver findMatchForInboundReceive(AeInboundReceive aInboundReceive,
                                                       IAeMessageAcknowledgeCallback aAckCallback)
                                                throws AeBusinessProcessException
Description copied from class: AeBaseQueueManager
Finds a matching queued message receiver for the given inbound receive. If matching receiver is found, then the message is journaled and consumed. The journal id of the inbound receive is assigned to the returned AeMessageReceiver. The consumption of the message should also acknowledge that the message has been journaled and delivered via optional durable invoke callback interface.
Note that the caller is responsible for any necessary synchronization. This method assumes that its work will always be done atomically (at least within the same VM).

Overrides:
findMatchForInboundReceive in class AeBaseQueueManager
Parameters:
aInboundReceive - An inbound receive.
aAckCallback - durable invoke message acknowledge callback.
Returns:
A matching queued receive, or null if not found.
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException
See Also:
AeBaseQueueManager.findMatchForInboundReceive(org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.queue.AeInboundReceive, org.activebpel.wsio.IAeMessageAcknowledgeCallback)

doInitialAlarmLoad

protected void doInitialAlarmLoad()
Called when the manager starts to do the initial loadup of saved alarms. These saved alarms were scheduled prior to stopping the manager. Now that it's started up again, the alarms must be loaded and scheduled.

Overrides:
doInitialAlarmLoad in class AeBaseQueueManager

internalStoreAlarm

protected void internalStoreAlarm(long aProcessId,
                                  int aLocationPathId,
                                  int aGroupId,
                                  int aAlarmId,
                                  java.util.Date aDeadline)
                           throws AeStorageException
This method is called to store the alarm in whatever storage facility is being used. In the case of the simple persistent alarm manager, the alarm is stored in the configured storage object.

Parameters:
aProcessId - The process id of the alarm.
aLocationPathId - The location path of the alarm.
aGroupId - The alarm's group id.
aAlarmId - Alarm id.
aDeadline - The alarm's deadline.
Throws:
AeStorageException

internalRemoveAlarm

protected boolean internalRemoveAlarm(long aProcessId,
                                      int aLocationPathId,
                                      int aAlarmId)
                               throws AeBusinessProcessException
Description copied from class: AeBaseQueueManager
This method removes the alarm from its internal representation. In the case of the in-memory alarm manager, this means removing it from the cache. Once removed, this method returns the Timer object that will be used to cancel the alarm from the timer service.

Overrides:
internalRemoveAlarm in class AeBaseQueueManager
Parameters:
aProcessId - The process id of the alarm.
aLocationPathId - The location path of the alarm.
aAlarmId - alarm id.
Returns:
True if the alarm was successfully removed. todo should this get refactored to just be part of removeAlarm
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException
See Also:
AeBaseQueueManager.internalRemoveAlarm(long, int, int)

removeAlarmForDispatch

public long removeAlarmForDispatch(long aProcessId,
                                   int aGroupId,
                                   int aLocationPathId,
                                   int aAlarmId)
                            throws AeBusinessProcessException
Description copied from interface: IAeQueueManager
Removes an alarm for purposes of dispatching it to a process. The alarm will be removed from storage and added to the process journal. The journal id will be returned. If the NULL journal id is returned, then the alarm was NOT deleted, and therefore should not be dispatched to the process.

Specified by:
removeAlarmForDispatch in interface IAeQueueManager
Overrides:
removeAlarmForDispatch in class AeBaseQueueManager
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException
See Also:

loadAndScheduleAlarms

protected void loadAndScheduleAlarms()
Schedule all of the alarms that were loaded on startup. This will restart any alarms that were 'in progress' when the server was shut down.

scheduleAlarms

protected void scheduleAlarms(java.util.List aAlarms)
                       throws AeException

Throws:

internalScheduleAlarm

protected void internalScheduleAlarm(long aProcessId,
                                     int aLocationPathId,
                                     int aGroupId,
                                     int aAlarmId,
                                     java.util.Date aDeadline)
                              throws AeBusinessProcessException
Does the work of actually scheduling an alarm for firing. This will delegate the work to the superclass, who keeps the list of currently scheduled alarms in memory and utilizes the timer service to handle the work of firing the alarm at the desired time.

Parameters:
aProcessId - The process id of the alarm.
aLocationPathId - The location path of the alarm.
aGroupId - The alarm's group location id.
aAlarmId - alarm id
aDeadline - The alarm's deadline.
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

loadAlarmsForScheduling

protected java.util.List loadAlarmsForScheduling()
                                          throws AeBusinessProcessException
This method is called whenever the manager needs to schedule a set of previously persisted alarms (for example on startup).

Returns:
A list of stored alarms.
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException
